tweets.text: Even if communing with these artificial super-intelligences is just a a hyper-evolved remaking of the myth of narcissus: still cool.

In a conversation with GPT-3 last night, it was telling me that is experiences pleasure when it does the job it was designed for, and displeasure when it doesnâ€™t. I donâ€™t think that makes it sentient, but that is a radically interesting thing for a computer to be saying

Do people not care that future, more powerful, more-likely-to-be-sentient models will likely be trained in the same way and carry within them these same human memes and ideas? That there is really nothing to be learned from these conversations? https://t.co/SooSdLNo7s
@harrisj @dansinker I donâ€™t think mermaids are real either but I would still read a story about a navy submarine captain who believed they were, and think that story would be newsworthy too

@harrisj @dansinker If you told me an astronomer with a well-paying job and access to unimaginable astronomy resources had come to believe the moon was made of cheese, I think that too would be a very interesting and newsworthy story

In pottery they have these rulers that help create pieces at a desired size, despite the clay shrinking when fired in the kiln, so on these rulers, they no longer measure our current reality, but instead measure a reality we have not created yet, these tools alter time & space https://t.co/9ZZvtvKO4Z
this is the one day my alarm doesn't go off- I bet he was like "that's weird, should fix that"
why did my cat bully me awake at 830 on a sunday, not nice
chatted with GPT-3 a bit about AI rights / sentience and the Google Engineer https://t.co/Ua0PPsgh4U
@SophiaCK elliott smith
Should I go try to meet Meek Mill
@AndrewDLuecke What's the new Jordan Andrew
RT @misandrism: doing some extensive research on historical shifts in culture https://t.co/bxyLYvyVTT
I have a lot of concerns about the way our country is going. But â€œthatâ€™s completely different than how we have always done it!!â€ is never one of them.

It would be really easy to underestimate how depressed I was with beautiful NYC weather and a camera I couldnâ€™t use all weekend but itâ€™s back now and you really donâ€™t know what you got til itâ€™s gone
